New Records: Rohit Sharma scored 50 off 19 balls, his fastest in all T20s.
Rohit Sharma hit 200+ sixes, the most by anybody in T20Is.
Rohit Sharma hit 8 sixes in this game, the most by an Indian in an innings in the T20 World Cup.
Rohit Sharma contributed 50 of India's 52 runs, a T20I record for the lowest team score when a batter's made a half-century.
India's 100 runs in 8.4 overs is their fastest in T20 World Cups.
Rohit Sharma's 29 runs in an over is the most expensive over Mitchell Starc has ever bowled for Australia in any format of cricket.
Key Match Events: Rohit Sharma scored 92 off 41 balls, hitting 76 of his runs in boundaries.
Jasprit Bumrah took a crucial wicket of Travis Head with a slower ball.
Kuldeep Yadav bowled Glenn Maxwell with a googly, a pivotal moment in the game.
Axar Patel took a spectacular catch to dismiss Mitchell Marsh.
Mitchell Marsh and Travis Head provided strong starts for Australia, but India managed to contain them.
David Warner was dismissed by Arshdeep Singh, potentially his last T20I match.
Josh Hazlewood bowled a masterful spell, giving away only 14 runs in four overs and taking the wicket of Virat Kohli.
Mitchell Starc recovered to take the wickets of Rohit Sharma and Suryakumar Yadav.
Pre-Game Insights: Mitchell Marsh mentioned the pitch looked like a belter and emphasized their experience in high-pressure World Cup matches.
Rohit Sharma noted the pitch looked good and emphasized the importance of adapting to challenges.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma's performance was highlighted as the reason for India's victory and their progression to the semi-finals.
Australia needs Bangladesh to beat Afghanistan to have a chance at making the final four.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch was the same one used for the England vs South Africa game where 163 was defended.
The weather was cooler with significant cross-winds, potentially affecting play.
